articles.headline: With Trump in the White House, the Family Business Takes It Down a Notch
articles.snippet: The company’s only major deal since President Trump took office lacks customary big city flair. A strip mall is across the street.
articles.abstract: The company’s only major deal since President Trump took office lacks customary big city flair. A strip mall is across the street.
articles.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND, Miss. — Storage trailers, an idle dump truck and portable toilets surround the hotel construction site. A sign announces “opening fall 2017,” but residents say they haven’t seen significant activity for months.
articles.byline: By Steve Eder, Ben Protess and Eric Lipton

articles.headline: Security Council Tightens Economic Vise on North Korea, Blocking Fuel, Ships and Workers
articles.snippet: The new sanctions, adopted 15 to 0, could constrict North Korea’s supplies of fuel and foreign currency, but experts say sanctions alone are unlikely to halt its nuclear program.
articles.abstract: The new sanctions, adopted 15 to 0, could constrict North Korea’s supplies of fuel and foreign currency, but experts say sanctions alone are unlikely to halt its nuclear program.
articles.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — The United Nations Security Council placed new sanctions on North Korea on Friday that significantly choke off fuel supplies and order North Koreans working overseas to return home, in what may prove the last test of whether any amount of economic pressure can force the isolated country to reverse course on its nuclear weapons program.
articles.byline: By Rick Gladstone and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Prosecutors Said to Seek Kushner Records From Deutsche Bank
articles.snippet: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn subpoenaed records about entities associated with the family company of President Trump’s son-in-law, people briefed on the matter said.
articles.abstract: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn subpoenaed records about entities associated with the family company of President Trump’s son-in-law, people briefed on the matter said.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn have sought bank records about entities associated with the family company of Jared Kushner, President Trump’s son-in-law and senior adviser, according to four people briefed on the matter.
articles.byline: By Ben Protess, Jessica Silver-Greenberg and David Enrich

articles.headline: F.B.I. Director Wants to Move Forward, but the President Is Making His Job Harder
articles.snippet: Christopher Wray tries steer a bureau the president has said is in “Tatters.”
articles.abstract: Christopher Wray tries steer a bureau the president has said is in “Tatters.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Trump tapped Christopher A. Wray to be his next F.B.I. director, it signaled a clear break from the tenure of James B. Comey, whom Mr. Trump had grown to distrust and eventually fired.
articles.byline: By Adam Goldman and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Jeanine Pirro of Fox News Helps an Old Friend: President Trump
articles.snippet: After a White House visit, the Fox News host has called for the firing of Robert Mueller and said F.B.I. agents should be “taken out in cuffs.”
articles.abstract: After a White House visit, the Fox News host has called for the firing of Robert Mueller and said F.B.I. agents should be “taken out in cuffs.”
articles.lead_paragraph: A few years ago, not long after Jeanine Pirro paid a visit to Donald J. Trump at his Trump Tower office, a box arrived at her home in Rye, N.Y.

articles.headline: Rupert Murdoch and President Trump: A Friendship of Convenience
articles.snippet: After decades of mutual wariness, the two titans now have a close relationship — just in time for Disney’s proposed acquisition of 21st Century Fox.
articles.abstract: After decades of mutual wariness, the two titans now have a close relationship — just in time for Disney’s proposed acquisition of 21st Century Fox.
articles.lead_paragraph: The calls to the White House come at least once a week. “Murdoch here,” the blunt, accented voice on the other end of the line says.

articles.headline: The Las Vegas Gunman Was Rich. Will His Wealth Go to the Victims?
articles.snippet: Stephen Paddock’s family supports the idea of giving his money to victims. The challenge will be to make sure it’s not depleted by legal expenses.
articles.abstract: Stephen Paddock’s family supports the idea of giving his money to victims. The challenge will be to make sure it’s not depleted by legal expenses.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Las Vegas gunman Stephen Paddock stands out among American mass killers because of his wealth. He became a millionaire, according to his family, through the buying and selling of real estate and through skillful high-stakes gambling.

articles.headline: Stoking Fears, Trump Defied Bureaucracy to Advance Immigration Agenda
articles.snippet: The changes have had far-reaching consequences, both for the immigrants who have sought to make a new home in this country and for America’s image in the world.
articles.abstract: The changes have had far-reaching consequences, both for the immigrants who have sought to make a new home in this country and for America’s image in the world.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Late to his own meeting and waving a sheet of numbers, President Trump stormed into the Oval Office one day in June, plainly enraged.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Julie Hirschfeld Davis

articles.headline: At Vice, Cutting-Edge Media and Allegations of Old-School Sexual Harassment
articles.snippet: A media company built on subversion and outlandishness was unable to create “a safe and inclusive workplace” for women, two of its founders acknowledge.
articles.abstract: A media company built on subversion and outlandishness was unable to create “a safe and inclusive workplace” for women, two of its founders acknowledge.
articles.lead_paragraph: One woman said she was riding a Ferris wheel at Coney Island after a company event when a co-worker suddenly took her hand and put it on his crotch. Another said she felt pressured into a sexual relationship with an executive and was fired after she rejected him.

articles.headline: The Hunt for ISIS Pivots to Remaining Pockets in Syria
articles.snippet: The last phase of the American campaign against the caliphate is relying heavily on warplanes that are focused on an area half the size of Manhattan.
articles.abstract: The last phase of the American campaign against the caliphate is relying heavily on warplanes that are focused on an area half the size of Manhattan.
articles.lead_paragraph: AL UDEID AIR BASE, Qatar — Secretive drones and surveillance jets are boring down on an estimated 3,000 remaining Islamic State fighters, who are hiding in Syria along a short stretch of the Euphrates River and surrounding deserts, as the American military campaign against the extremist group enters its final phase.

articles.headline: Town Fights to Turn Retail Tide at a Little Mall That Might
articles.snippet: A faded industrial town in the North Country region of New York State is relying on local residents’ crafts and wits to make its shopping center a destination again.
articles.abstract: A faded industrial town in the North Country region of New York State is relying on local residents’ crafts and wits to make its shopping center a destination again.
articles.lead_paragraph: MASSENA, N.Y. — When the Payless ShoeSource at the St. Lawrence Center closed this spring, it could have been just another statistic in a grim year for retailers, one more struggling shop gone in a dilapidated mall.
articles.byline: By Michael Corkery and David Gelles

articles.headline: After a Chaotic Start, Congress Has Made a Conservative Mark
articles.snippet: The 115th Congress, under Republican control, has left a conservative imprint on the courts, taxation, regulation and the environment. Next up: poverty programs.
articles.abstract: The 115th Congress, under Republican control, has left a conservative imprint on the courts, taxation, regulation and the environment. Next up: poverty programs.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After a halting start, the Republican-controlled 115th Congress — sometimes in collaboration with President Trump, often despite him — has enacted surprisingly far-reaching conservative achievements in its first year, among them a long-promised rewrite of the tax code, oil drilling in the Arctic and a series of lifetime appointments to the judiciary.

articles.headline: Prince Harry Is Getting Married. Time for Themed Mugs and Nightclub Tours.
articles.snippet: Britain’s monarchy can be big money. And with a royal wedding next year, tour groups, ceramics makers and other companies are trying to capitalize.
articles.abstract: Britain’s monarchy can be big money. And with a royal wedding next year, tour groups, ceramics makers and other companies are trying to capitalize.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The cameras had barely finished flashing on the newly engaged Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. But Emma Bridgewater, a British ceramics manufacturer, was already making a mug to commemorate the royal moment.

articles.headline: Trump Administration Eases Nursing Home Fines in Victory for Industry
articles.snippet: Medicare is discouraging the use of penalties for what it considers “one-time mistakes” and in other circumstances. The changes come in response to industry pressure.
articles.abstract: Medicare is discouraging the use of penalties for what it considers “one-time mistakes” and in other circumstances. The changes come in response to industry pressure.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Trump administration is scaling back the use of fines against nursing homes that harm residents or place them in grave risk of injury, part of a broader relaxation of regulations under the president.

articles.headline: Why Saad Hariri Had That Strange Sojourn in Saudi Arabia
articles.snippet: Mr. Hariri, Lebanon’s prime minister, expected the royal treatment when he was summoned to Riyadh. Instead, he was told to resign. Here is the back story.
articles.abstract: Mr. Hariri, Lebanon’s prime minister, expected the royal treatment when he was summoned to Riyadh. Instead, he was told to resign. Here is the back story.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Lebanon’s prime minister, Saad Hariri, was summoned at 8:30 a.m. to the Saudi royal offices — unseemly early, by the kingdom’s standards — on the second day of a visit that was already far from what he had expected.
articles.byline: By Anne Barnard and Maria Abi-Habib

articles.headline: Spielberg’s ‘The Post’ Provides Fitting End to Turbulent Year for the Media
articles.snippet: A movie offers a reminder that leaking to the press can be a patriotic act at a time when the president delights in attacking journalists.
articles.abstract: A movie offers a reminder that leaking to the press can be a patriotic act at a time when the president delights in attacking journalists.
articles.lead_paragraph: After a year of high- and low-level attacks on the press and the First Amendment, there’s plenty to appreciate in Steven Spielberg’s new movie, “The Post,” which some people around here believe should be called “The Times.”

articles.headline: Using Billions in Government Cash, Mexico Controls News Media
articles.snippet: Federal and state officials wield huge budgets for public advertising to dictate news coverage, routinely telling outlets what they should — and should not — report.
articles.abstract: Federal and state officials wield huge budgets for public advertising to dictate news coverage, routinely telling outlets what they should — and should not — report.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — Running a newspaper, radio station or television outlet in Mexico usually means relying on a single, powerful client that spends exorbitant sums on advertising with a simple warning: “I do not pay you to criticize me.”
